alert.note: Alert for Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 18 at 7:16PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...MENDENHALL LAKE AND RIVER LEVELS REMAIN HIGH... Water levels along the Mendenhall Lake and Mendenhall River in Juneau continue to slowly rise due to heavy rainfall earlier in the week. Lake levels are expected to crest by mid morning just below 9 feet, and a slow fall is expected through the day on Friday as no additional precipitation is forecast for the area. People living along the lake and river, and anyone recreating on the river should use caution and stay alert to any additional changes in water levels. When the lake level is near 8 feet, Nugget Falls trail sees some flooding. Along the Mendenhall River, these increased water levels and faster flows result in bank erosion and dangerous tree-fall along the river.

area.areaDesc: Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island
